H0.text: who was the successful commanding general of the northern forces in the civil war. Ulysses S. Grant

H1.text: who was the successful commanding general of the northern forces in the civil war. William Tecumseh Sherman

H2.text: who was the successful commanding general of the northern forces in the civil war. Ambrose Burnside

H3.text: who was the successful commanding general of the northern forces in the civil war. George B. McClellan

A4.text: In 1863, he led the Vicksburg campaign that gave Union forces control of the Mississippi River and dealt a major strategic blow to the Confederacy.

A5.text: The poorly led Union troops under Major General Ambrose Burnside and Brigadier General James H. Ledlie, rather than encircling the crater, rushed into it. Recovering from the surprise, Confederates, led by Major General William Mahone, surrounded the crater and easily picked off Union troops.
